actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

actions.subcommittee: Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition, and Forestry

official_title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out a pilot program to evaluate the feasibility and merits of State administration of units of the National Forest System.
short_title: National Forests Improvement Pilot Program Act

summary.text: National Forests Improvement Pilot Program Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to: (1) carry out a ten-year pilot program (with a discretionary ten-year extension) in three Forest Service Regions (representing different ecosystems) to evaluate State administration of National Forest System lands; (2) contract with the Forest Stewardship Council to evaluate such forests' environmental progress; (3) terminate the pilot program with respect to a test forest whose environmental condition worsens; and (4) carry out the program through the use of reserved Forest Service funds.

titles.title: National Forests Improvement Pilot Program Act
To require the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out a pilot program to evaluate the feasibility and merits of State administration of units of the National Forest System.
